attributes.action: Make it part of the UK Driving Test for all new drivers to experience a "seat-belt-sled" to give them actual experience of the physics involved in a car crash.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many people putting in for their driving test, especially young people, are not even remotely aware of the huge forces at work when they sit inside a car weighing around a Ton or more as they propel it along the road.

If it were part of the driving test to simply sit in a "seat-belt-sled" and actually feel the impact of a dead-stop at something like just 5 miles per hour ... I'm sure many more (especially young) drivers would then become much more aware of the consequences of getting into a crash and would be much more cautious about driving either too fast or driving recklessly as a result.

Very cheap to implement, takes less than 1 minute to strap-in and experience the "sled" and could potentially save many, many, many lives.
